intro: Castellanoa, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plants typically grow in rocky or dry soils and are often found in mountainous areas. Castellanoa species are herbaceous perennials, with some varieties producing showy blooms in late summer. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
